SLANG.Definition: very informal language that is usually spoken rather than written, used especially by particular groups of people

RESTRICTED TO.Definition: limited to one particular thing or activity

CAME TO MIND.Definition: the past tense of the phrase come to mind which means to appear in one’s thoughts

TUCK IN.Definition: To thrust or fold the edge so as to secure or confine (search ‘tuck in shirt’ to see an example)

LOAN.Definition: an act of lending something, especially a sum of money that has to be paid back with interest or an amount of money that has been lent

SCHOLARSHIP.Definition: an amount of money given by a school, college, university, or other organization to pay for the studies of a person with great ability but little money

VULGAR.Definition: not appropriate, simple, dignified or beautiful; not in the style preferred by the upper classes of society

TOOK OVER.Definition: The past tense of the phrasal verb take over which means to begin to have control of something

ETHNICITIES.Definition: The plural form of the noun ethnicity which is a large group of people who have the same national, racial, or cultural origins, or the state of belonging to such a group

DIALECT.Definition: a form of a language that is spoken in a particular part of a country or by a particular group of people and that contains some words, grammar, or pronunciations that are different from the forms used in other parts or by other groups

GUIDELINES.Definition: information intended to advise people on how something should be done or what something should be

AMONGST.Definition: happening or being included as part of a group of people or things

STANDARD.Definition: a pattern or model that is generally accepted

COEXIST.Definition: to live or exist together, esp. in peace, at the same time or in the same place

IRRATIONAL.Definition: not using reason or clear thinking

AWARE.Definition: knowing that something exists, or having knowledge or experience of a particular thing

SUMMARIZE.Definition: to express the most important facts or ideas about something or someone in a short and clear form

CONNOTATION.Definition: a feeling or idea that is suggested by a particular word even if it is not a part of the word's meaning

NIGGA.Definition: A racial slur for black Americans. However, the meaning of the word changes depending on the context.

GIGANTIC.Definition: of very great size or extent; huge or enormous

DYNAMICS.Definition: (in this context,) the forces that control the relationships people or things have with each other and how those relationships can change

SEGREGATED.Definition: kept separate or treated differently according to race, sex, religion, etc.

EVOLUTION.Definition: a gradual process of change and development

FOR THE MOST PART.Definition: a gradual process of change and development

SLOWS YOU DOWN.Definition: to slow down means to decrease the speed of something

RICHER.Definition: The comparative form of the adjective rich which (in this context) means having or containing a large amount of something desirable or valuable
